<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/05/coronavirus-sinks-disney-q2-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Disney’s World Is Getting Real Small
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Disney castle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MzIvZGlzbmV5X2Nhc3RsZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After reporting earnings yesterday, Disney might be looking to downgrade from castle to fifth-story walkup. Revenue for the quarter <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/05/disney-dis-q2-2020-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">edged out</a> expectations at $18 billion, but COVID-19 cost it $1.4 billion in operating profit. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line at the top: </strong>COVID-19 has caused “considerable disruption,” but keep in mind Disney was reporting the quarter ended March 28. This quarter is expected to be worse.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The foot traffic</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Revenue in Disney’s parks segment fell 10% to $5.5 billion while operating income dipped 58%. Execs pegged COVID-19 losses at $1 billion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The parks division was the company's profit driver before. Now, it’s feeling like an anchor. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Disney’s attractions in Asia felt COVID-19 earlier, with parks in Shanghai and Hong Kong closing down in late January.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But as things return to “some semblance of normalcy in China,” the reopening of Shanghai Disney on May 11 could provide clues as to how parks will bounce back elsewhere. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disney will limit attendance and practice containment measures including masks, temperature screenings, and contact tracing.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The eyeballs </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Revenue in Disney’s Direct-to-Consumer & International segment was a bright spot, growing to $4.1 billion last quarter from $1.1 billion a year earlier. No fairy godmothers there, just the addition of streaming platform Disney+, which now has <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/05/disney-reports-33point5-million-disney-plus-subscribers-at-end-of-q2.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">54.5 million subscribers</a>—an increase of more than 20 million since the quarter ended.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Prior to the pandemic, Disney was coming off a remarkable year, but the last few weeks have stung. It furloughed 100,000+ workers and delayed major releases. One analyst estimates it’s losing at least $30 million a day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While brand affinity is as strong as ever...Disney was built around Dole Whips, not La-Z-Boys. Lightshed Partners’ Rich Greenfield downgraded Disney stock ahead of earnings, noting “Disney is built on shared group experiences. Until there is global comfort health-wise with that behavior again, Disney’s earnings are fundamentally impaired.”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/05/meat-shortage-hamstrings-wendys-gives-alternative-meat-boost?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When There's a Meat Shortage, It's Good Not to Sell Meat
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Get your spatulas and Steve Miller Band, it’s time for burger news. The big takeaway? The <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/27/tyson-foods-chairman-warns-food-supply-chain-breaking?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coronavirus-related meat shortage</a> is a boost for some and food poisoning for others.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">First up is Beyond Meat. The plant-based meat company beat top and bottom-line expectations in earnings reported yesterday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Beyond may be plant-based, but Q1 net sales of $97 million packed plenty of protein. Its stock has jumped more than 85% since mid-March. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The company is angling to benefit from animal meat’s woes. Founder Ethan Brown </span><span><a href="https://money.yahoo.com/beyond-meat-earnings-beat-expectations-founder-says-its-the-plantbased-meat-industrys-moment-200551640.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Yahoo Finance</a></span><span>, “this is the industry’s moment.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Rival Impossible Foods agrees. Grocery chain Kroger, which had to limit meat purchases per customer to deal with the shortage, inked a deal to sell Impossible Burgers in 1,700 stores. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">As for traditional meat purveyors...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They're purveying less meat. Yesterday, Wendy’s <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/05/business/wendys-beef-shortage/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> some menu items aren’t available due to the meat shortage. To clarify that “some,” 18% of Wendy’s U.S. restaurants are not serving meat-based items, the financial firm Stephens estimates.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GIG ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/05/california-sues-uber-lyft-employee-classification?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
California Hits Uber and Lyft While They're Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Uber ride-hail and mobility" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82Mi91YmVyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Step 1: Flatten the curve. Step 2: Resume blows with your favorite punching bags. Yesterday, California <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/uber-lyft-face-landmark-lawsuit-over-gig-worker-classification-n1200526?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued</a> Uber and Lyft for allegedly failing to reclassify contracted workers as employees under AB5, a new law that went into effect in January. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>AG Xavier Becerra is accusing the ride-hailers of depriving drivers of the minimum wage rights, overtime pay, and other benefits they'd be entitled to as employees. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The lawsuit seeks millions in penalties and unpaid wages for drivers. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>After AB5 went into effect, Uber, Lyft, and other gig economy companies <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/01/04/793142903/as-california-tries-to-make-contract-workers-employees-industries-push-back?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">refused</a> to comply, then went on the offensive.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They started talking to lawmakers about creating a new category of workers, essentially contractors with benefits. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Uber and Postmates filed a lawsuit challenging AB5. And gig companies poured $100+ million into a November ballot measure that would exempt them from the law. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>legal battles will be a problem for another week, since Lyft reports earnings this afternoon and Uber's up tomorrow. Both are teetering from the pandemic. Lyft recently announced plans to lay off 17% of workers, and Uber is reportedly considering a 20% reduction in headcount.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY UBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

Get in on These Insights
</font></a>
</h1>

<a href="https://www.ubs.com/microsites/wma/insights/en/investing/2020/looking-ahead.html?campID=SOME-ISMORNINGBREWAPR2020-US-ENG-MORNINGBREW-ANY-ANY-20200506-SHAREDLINK-US-PAID" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="UBS" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvNjM2LzE1ODg2MTkyMzctRW5nbGlzaF9DaGFsbGVuZ2luZ1RpbWVzLXRleHQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As our crafting, pottering, puzzling, cooking, bird-watching, and crocheting has proven, we are no experts. So when an expert is spotted in our midst, our little ears perk up like our poor dog who we tried and failed to groom. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Enter UBS</strong>: The investing and banking powerhouse who has deemed the Brew faithful worthy of their <a href="https://www.ubs.com/microsites/wma/insights/en/investing/2020/looking-ahead.html?campID=SOME-ISMORNINGBREWAPR2020-US-ENG-MORNINGBREW-ANY-ANY-20200506-SHAREDLINK-US-PAID" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Investor Sentiment Survey</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On this thankfully simple yet comprehensive page, you’ll learn quite a few things about how the world’s best investors are viewing our current situation:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>32% of investors say it’s a good time to buy stocks</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>33% even plan to invest more during this time</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>78% of US investors have a positive long-term outlook on the economy</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nice to have a little sunshine between all the doom and gloom. Exhibit A: While concerns over the pandemic’s effect on the economy still loom large, UBS also found that 24% of business owners polled will continue to hire. Music to a business newsletter’s ears.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.ubs.com/microsites/wma/insights/en/investing/2020/looking-ahead.html?campID=SOME-ISMORNINGBREWAPR2020-US-ENG-MORNINGBREW-ANY-ANY-20200506-SHAREDLINK-US-PAID" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Invest some time in UBS’s insights today</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
State Reopening Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Reopening tracker2" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MzQvcmVvcGVuaW5nX3RyYWNrZXIyLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jenny "Kahlo" Rothenberg/Samir "Monet" Sheth</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Green: </strong>Green means go...with extreme caution. Governments have allowed many nonessential businesses to reopen (with heavy restrictions) in these states.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Yellow: </strong>Restrictions will start to ease in the next week or two. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Blue:</strong> Broader reopenings have a slightly longer timeline than the yellow states, but there's movement and already some easing of lockdowns.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Gray: </strong>These states are still watching, waiting before putting more aggressive opening plans into place. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Important to note...just like U.S. states aren't easing restrictions at the same time, neither are local jurisdictions within those states. Pennsylvania, for example, has a <a href="https://www.mcall.com/coronavirus/mc-nws-coronavirus-pa-phases-reopening-20200423-lxrlegabcvfdhotgvqo5pjids4-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">color-coded system</a> that guides strategy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Also important to note...COVID-19 cases are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/05/us/coronavirus-deaths-cases-united-states.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still rising</a> outside of the NYC metro area, and <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-latest-news-05-05-2020-11588669450?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">experts warn</a> reopenings could lead to a surge in cases.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/29/us-states-reopening-economies?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">See your state's reopening timeline here</a>.</p>
</td>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
NIGHTLIFE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/05/global-concertgoers-find-pandemic-workarounds?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When You’re Starving for Untz
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Production Club suit" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MzEvcHJvZHVjdGlvbl9jbHViX3N1aXQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Production Club</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ll take it any way you can get it. The neon-clad raver community is finding creative ways to vibe while respecting social distancing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the U.S.,</strong> LA design studio Production Club created the <a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/design/a32292017/micrashell-social-distancing-concert-suit/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Micrashell</a>, a post-pandemic form of concertwear. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How it works: The suit goes on the top half of your body, can be disinfected, and features a ventilation system and an audio setup that lets you mute people IRL. Production Club plans to partner with venues to distribute the suit and ensure epidemiologically responsible vibing. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In Germany</strong>, ravers are simply doing what nature intended—going to raves, in their cars. At drive-in raves in Schüttorf, Lower Saxony, partygoers could listen either to the stage soundsystem or tune in to an internet broadcast. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Attendees showed their appreciation for the DJs by laying on their horns. Yes, it </span><span><a href="https://mixmag.net/read/worlds-first-drive-in-rave-germany-news?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was a bizarre scene</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Online, </strong>rave culture is flourishing in the absence of physical music festivals. Here's a list of <a href="https://www.iheartraves.com/blogs/post/edm-live-streams?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upcoming EDM live streams</a>.</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter reporting earnings yesterday, Disney might be looking to downgrade from castle to fifth-story walkup. Revenue for the quarter \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/05/disney-dis-q2-2020-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" it $1.4 billion in operating profit. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line at the top: \u003c/strong\u003eCOVID-19 has caused “considerable disruption,” but keep in mind Disney was reporting the quarter ended March 28. This quarter is expected to be worse.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe foot traffic\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRevenue in Disney’s parks segment fell 10% to $5.5 billion while operating income dipped 58%. Execs pegged COVID-19 losses at $1 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe parks division was the company's profit driver before. Now, it’s feeling like an anchor. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDisney’s attractions in Asia felt COVID-19 earlier, with parks in Shanghai and Hong Kong closing down in late January.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut as things return to “some semblance of normalcy in China,” the reopening of Shanghai Disney on May 11 could provide clues as to how parks will bounce back elsewhere. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDisney will limit attendance and practice containment measures including masks, temperature screenings, and contact tracing.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe eyeballs \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRevenue in Disney’s Direct-to-Consumer \u0026 International segment was a bright spot, growing to $4.1 billion last quarter from $1.1 billion a year earlier. No fairy godmothers there, just the addition of streaming platform Disney+, which now has \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/05/disney-reports-33point5-million-disney-plus-subscribers-at-end-of-q2.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e54.5 million subscribers\u003c/a\u003e—an increase of more than 20 million since the quarter ended.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePrior to the pandemic, Disney was coming off a remarkable year, but the last few weeks have stung. It furloughed 100,000+ workers and delayed major releases. One analyst estimates it’s losing at least $30 million a day.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile brand affinity is as strong as ever...Disney was built around Dole Whips, not La-Z-Boys. Lightshed Partners’ Rich Greenfield downgraded Disney stock ahead of earnings, noting “Disney is built on shared group experiences. Until there is global comfort health-wise with that behavior again, Disney’s earnings are fundamentally impaired.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGet your spatulas and Steve Miller Band, it’s time for burger news. The big takeaway? The \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/27/tyson-foods-chairman-warns-food-supply-chain-breaking?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecoronavirus-related meat shortage\u003c/a\u003e is a boost for some and food poisoning for others.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFirst up is Beyond Meat. The plant-based meat company beat top and bottom-line expectations in earnings reported yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBeyond may be plant-based, but Q1 net sales of $97 million packed plenty of protein. Its stock has jumped more than 85% since mid-March. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe company is angling to benefit from animal meat’s woes. Founder Ethan Brown \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://money.yahoo.com/beyond-meat-earnings-beat-expectations-founder-says-its-the-plantbased-meat-industrys-moment-200551640.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Yahoo Finance\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, “this is the industry’s moment.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRival Impossible Foods agrees. Grocery chain Kroger, which had to limit meat purchases per customer to deal with the shortage, inked a deal to sell Impossible Burgers in 1,700 stores. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAs for traditional meat purveyors...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey're purveying less meat. Yesterday, Wendy’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/05/business/wendys-beef-shortage/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e some menu items aren’t available due to the meat shortage. To clarify that “some,” 18% of Wendy’s U.S. restaurants are not serving meat-based items, the financial firm Stephens estimates.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStep 1: Flatten the curve. Step 2: Resume blows with your favorite punching bags. Yesterday, California \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/uber-lyft-face-landmark-lawsuit-over-gig-worker-classification-n1200526?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esued\u003c/a\u003e Uber and Lyft for allegedly failing to reclassify contracted workers as employees under AB5, a new law that went into effect in January. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAG Xavier Becerra is accusing the ride-hailers of depriving drivers of the minimum wage rights, overtime pay, and other benefits they'd be entitled to as employees. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe lawsuit seeks millions in penalties and unpaid wages for drivers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter AB5 went into effect, Uber, Lyft, and other gig economy companies \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/01/04/793142903/as-california-tries-to-make-contract-workers-employees-industries-push-back?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erefused\u003c/a\u003e to comply, then went on the offensive.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey started talking to lawmakers about creating a new category of workers, essentially contractors with benefits. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUber and Postmates filed a lawsuit challenging AB5. And gig companies poured $100+ million into a November ballot measure that would exempt them from the law. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003elegal battles will be a problem for another week, since Lyft reports earnings this afternoon and Uber's up tomorrow. Both are teetering from the pandemic. Lyft recently announced plans to lay off 17% of workers, and Uber is reportedly considering a 20% reduction in headcount.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou’ll take it any way you can get it. The neon-clad raver community is finding creative ways to vibe while respecting social distancing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the U.S.,\u003c/strong\u003e LA design studio Production Club created the \u003ca href=\"https://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/design/a32292017/micrashell-social-distancing-concert-suit/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMicrashell\u003c/a\u003e, a post-pandemic form of concertwear. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHow it works: The suit goes on the top half of your body, can be disinfected, and features a ventilation system and an audio setup that lets you mute people IRL. Production Club plans to partner with venues to distribute the suit and ensure epidemiologically responsible vibing. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn Germany\u003c/strong\u003e, ravers are simply doing what nature intended—going to raves, in their cars. At drive-in raves in Schüttorf, Lower Saxony, partygoers could listen either to the stage soundsystem or tune in to an internet broadcast. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAttendees showed their appreciation for the DJs by laying on their horns. Yes, it \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://mixmag.net/read/worlds-first-drive-in-rave-germany-news?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas a bizarre scene\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOnline, \u003c/strong\u003erave culture is flourishing in the absence of physical music festivals.
